dict.acceptation: 激怒；使发怒；[医]〈旧，非正式〉使（伤口）炎或疼痛；恼火；

sent.orig: Anger at lies lasts forever. Anger at truth can't last.
sent.trans: 对谎言的愤怒永不消失，对真理的愤怒不会长久。

sent.orig: Pretending that the anger is not there is a form of resistance toward the anger.
sent.trans: 假装没有生气是抵抗它的一种形式。

sent.orig: Anger that we don't express to others can become anger that we turn against ourselves.
sent.trans: 我们没有向别人发泄的怒气会转而发泄到自己的身上。

sent.orig: Our anger was like the anger of children, passing quickly from one petty grievance to another.
sent.trans: 我们生气就象孩子生气一样，从一件小小的不平之事很快过渡到另一件事上。

sent.orig: "Our grief has turned to anger, and anger to resolution."
sent.trans: 我们的悲痛已转化成愤怒，因为愤怒我们下定了决心。
